blocks.value: St. Dominic Savio was born in Italy in 1842. He became a student of St. John Bosco at the age of 12. Despite his young age, Dominic showed exceptional holiness and dedication to God.

Dominic had a great love for the Eucharist and the Blessed Virgin Mary. He worked to prevent sin among his classmates and was known for his purity, obedience, and charity. His motto was "Death rather than sin!"

Dominic died of illness at the age of 14 in 1857. He was canonized by Pope Pius XII in 1954, making him one of the youngest non-martyrs to be canonized. He is the patron saint of choirboys and juvenile delinquents.
